** ridgeway crochet bandana cowl**

the ridgeway crochet bandana cowl was designed for the 7th annual marly bird turkey trot make-along (2025) and quickly became a fan favorite! 

this textured, triangle-shaped cowl combines cozy stitches and simple construction to create the look of a shawl with the ease of a cowl — no slipping, no fuss, just effortless style.

worked flat and then joined, the ridgeway sits comfortably around your neck like a warm bandana, perfect for layering during chilly weather. it’s approachable for adventurous beginners and satisfying for experienced crocheters looking for a relaxing make.

 the pattern is free on marlybird.com, with an ad-free pdf upgrade available for purchase.

**✨ pattern features**

skill level: advanced beginner

techniques: basic crochet stitches, shaping, and simple joining

construction: worked flat, then seamed to form a bandana cowl

yarn weight: worsted weight

recommended yarn: universal deluxe worsted yarn.
